snippet.textDisplay:
What I’d love people to say is that more than half of the people who’ve been shown to have had it are well now. You NEVER hear about those numbers in the headlines (shoutout to Johns Hopkins❤️).

What I wish people would actually focus on (and SHOULD be focusing on) is HANDWASHING AND NOT TOUCHING YOUR FACE. You know, the two easiest ways to stop transmission? If people spent as much time on that as they do talking about everything else and fearmongering, we’d be a lot better off.
But I’m just nurse involved in this mess so what do I know. We have nowhere near the numbers that other severely affected countries do, but we keep hearing that “IT’S COMING!”. It would be nice to see what the numbers would be if everyone stayed home when they were sick, already ill, and old, and WASH YOUR DAMN HANDS.

Closing schools because of this is silly (over a hundred kids have died from the flu this year, but that was fine and not worth closing schools for), especially when people say “we’re gonna close the schools, but we’re also gonna have a group meetup to give kids the free lunches they need”. Makes no sense. It’s doing more harm than good and people STILL aren’t even washing their hands properly.

Have I mentioned that people aren’t washing their hands properly??? Isolate all you want, but if people aren’t doing those little things, it’ll keep spreading.
snippet.textOriginal:

What I wish people would actually focus on (and SHOULD be focusing on) is HANDWASHING AND NOT TOUCHING YOUR FACE.  You know, the two easiest ways to stop transmission?  If people spent as much time on that as they do talking about everything else and fearmongering, we’d be a lot better off.  
 But I’m just nurse involved in this mess so what do I know.  We have nowhere near the numbers that other severely affected countries do, but we keep hearing that “IT’S COMING!”.  It would be nice to see what the numbers would be if everyone stayed home when they were sick, already ill, and old, and WASH YOUR DAMN HANDS. 

Closing schools because of this is silly (over a hundred kids have died from the flu this year, but that was fine and not worth closing schools for), especially when people say “we’re gonna close the schools, but we’re also gonna have a group meetup to give kids the free lunches they need”. Makes no sense. It’s doing more harm than good and people STILL aren’t even washing their hands properly.

Have I mentioned that people aren’t washing their hands properly??? Isolate all you want, but if people aren’t doing those little things, it’ll keep spreading.

snippet.textDisplay:
Advice on Corona virus by an Italian doctor.
This is an excerpt from a recommendation from the Italian doctor Dr. Lidia Rona turns on how to handle the rona virus. She is a specialist in pathology (the doctrine of blood and its diseases) and cardiac disorders. The advice is a little different from the one we otherwise get here at home
You don't stop the virus with panic, but with intelligence!
A scientist from Shenzhen, who has worked to combat the coronavirus epidemic in wuhan, describes what kind of virus this is, how it is transferred from person to person and how it can be neutralized:
Does not cause cold symptoms such as tight and running nose and cough, but dry cough.
The virus cannot withstand heat and die if it is exposed to temperatures above 26-27 degrees. It is therefore important to drink warm drinks such as tea and coffee several times a day. Hot drinks neutralize the virus.
Avoid cold drinks with ice cubes.
The Rona virus is great (a diameter of 400-500 Nanometres) and can be stopped by any kind of mask - it must not be a special mask. Only health professionals who are exposed to large quantities of viruses must use specialized equipment.
If someone who's infected sneeze 3 Feet from you, the virus falls to the ground and won't reach you.
The virus can survive for 12 hours on a metal surface. If you have been in contact with such surfaces - such as handles, doors, electric appliances, buses and metro, etc., you should wash hands thoroughly and diagnose them.
The virus doesn't survive in clothes for more than 6.5 hours, and normal cleaning agents can kill them. Clothes that can't be washed or can't tolerate daily wash can be exposed to sunlight - then the virus dies.
Here's how the virus manifests:
The virus is sitting down in the throat, causing inflammation and feeling dry in the throat. These symptoms last for 3-4 days.
The virus migrate with moisture through the respiratory tract into the lungs, causing pneumonia. It'll take 5-6 days.
Pneumonia manifests itself with high fever and breathing, not with a classic cold. If you feel like you are not breathing, please contact a doctor immediately.
To avoid the virus:
The virus is transferred primarily through direct contact, f. Ex. In the case of clothing or materials infected by the virus. It is therefore very important to wash hands frequently.
The virus only survives for 10 minutes on your hands, but in that time a lot can happen: you can dry your eyes, scratch your nose, and so that the virus can wander down your throat.
For your sake and others: Wash your hands often and sink them!
It's possible to flush with a disinfection gel that can limit the amount of virus that goes down your throat. This way, you can't walk out of there in the lungs.
You can diagnose keyboards and mice.
Everyone should follow these tips - both for their own sake and for the sake of others.
It may happen that the new rona virus np does not cause symptoms for the first few days. It can therefore be difficult to know if a person is infected. But at the moment it manifests itself with fever and cough, and you seek help in hospitals, often 50 % of the lungs are already infected, and it may be too late.
Taiwan experts recommend to take a simple test every morning:
Breathe Deep and hold your breath for 10 seconds. If you manage without coughing, feeling uncomfortable or chest tight, it means that your lungs are not infected and indicate that you don't have an infection.
Advice from doctors in Japan who treat those who have become sick with Navid-19:
Everyone should keep their mouth shut and throat moist by drinking a sip of water, preferably every 15 minutes.
Water and other liquids carry the bacteria into the stomach, and the stomach acid then causes the virus to die.
Please share the information with family, friends and acquaintances - so that you can help others.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm Italian and I'm in the red zone,
I can understand how you see the virus: only numbers, theories etc. something dangerous, but far away.
I also saw it like this. One day the news of a positive person arrives, in one week entire cities completely empty, hundreds then thousands of dead and from what they say the worst has not yet arrived.
Fear will come ... and fear is a good thing, because if you see the tsunami 100 kilometers away you are afraid, but you can prepare yourself, but when you see the tsunami 100 meters away you will panic.
You don't need government permission to do even little things that keep you and your family a little safer from an invisible enemy who luckily is still far from you

snippet.textDisplay:
so difficult to know what to believe and what not to believe, some doctors say it's like the common flu, others, like this one, says it will get worse. I think the numbers from the Princes Cruise Ships can tell us a lot, and those numbers don't lie: The Diamond Princess Cruise by The Numbers
First, what happened on this ship and is happening worldwide is a tragedy. So let’s keep that in perspective as we look at the Diamond Princess Cruise pandemic math:

There were 4,061 individuals tested who were exposed
705 tested positive
7 patients died
3 Japanese citizens in their 80’s
“An elderly Japanese man”-age unknown
British national in his 70’s
A 78 year old Australian national
Hong-Kong national-age unknown
The infection rate of those exposed is 17%
The fatality rate (exposed versus deaths) was 1.0%
What does all of that mean? The fact that only 17% contracted COVID-19 on a cruise ship that was out there for a month before being quarantined is NOT impressive. In fact, epidemiologists usually see 20-40% of individuals in a population test positive for the influenza virus during a bad flu pandemic.

Also, pay attention to the 1% fatality rate impacting mostly the elderly. That number had previously been reported as 0.85%. There was a new death recorded so that number has gone up. However, please note that the average age of cruise ship passengers is older by about a decade than the average age of the United States population.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm in Belgium.  Mindboggling how many Americans are not taking this thing seriously.  Italy has one of the world's best healthcare systems - yes way better than what you have in the USA - and they are litteraly in a war.  The only countries so far that are more or less able to flatten the curve are Asian countries like China, Japan, HongKong who 1. have experience with fighting outbreaks (sars, etc..) 2. who are by nature a far more disciplined people than us Westerns, more community sense, less individualism an 3.  have governments that act far more firmly than what other countries are used to.
